docs.abstract: A quarter in which Apple sold an enormous number of iPhones also saw compliance with workweek rules decrease.
docs.snippet: A quarter in which Apple sold an enormous number of iPhones also saw compliance with workweek rules decrease.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apple sold more iPhones last year than anyone could have imagined. But the company found that a lower percentage of factories assembling its products complied with a policy preventing excessive work hours.

docs.abstract: The Apple Watch is scheduled to debut in April, a bit later than the company had hoped, because of technology challenges.
docs.snippet: The Apple Watch is scheduled to debut in April, a bit later than the company had hoped, because of technology challenges.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For Apple, the hard part — making a smartwatch — is nearly over.

headline.main: Apple’s New Job: Selling a Smartwatch to an Uninterested Public
headline.print_headline: The Apple Watch Is Nearly Ready, but the Public Isn’t

docs.abstract: The move comes just a few months after the release of Apple Pay, Apple’s mobile payments product.
docs.snippet: The move comes just a few months after the release of Apple Pay, Apple’s mobile payments product.
docs.lead_paragraph: Samsung, the South Korean technology giant, announced Wednesday it had acquired LoopPay, a mobile payments company, signaling its interest in controlling smartphone-based purchases.

headline.main: Samsung Buys LoopPay, a Competitor to Apple’s Mobile Wallet
headline.print_headline: Samsung Acquires LoopPay, a Mobile Payments Company

docs.abstract: Both Kantar Worldpanel and Canalys, research firms that track global smartphone sales, said Apple’s mobile operating system gained market share in China at the expense of Google’s Android.
docs.snippet: Both Kantar Worldpanel and Canalys, research firms that track global smartphone sales, said Apple’s mobile operating system gained market share in China at the expense of Google’s Android.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Apple reported a record-shattering profit of $18 billion last month, the company said its growth came largely from sales in greater China. This week, some research firms gave a clearer picture of just how big Apple has become in China.

headline.main: New Data Shows Apple’s Explosive Growth in China

docs.abstract: Learn about the differences between Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV stick (besides price), and also discover how to transfer airline boarding passes between iPhones.
docs.snippet: Learn about the differences between Amazon Fire TV and Fire TV stick (besides price), and also discover how to transfer airline boarding passes between iPhones.

headline.main: Choosing Between Amazon’s TV Streaming Hardware

docs.abstract: Tips on how to archive Gmail messages to tidy up your inbox, and solutions for when your laptop battery begins to fade.
docs.snippet: Tips on how to archive Gmail messages to tidy up your inbox, and solutions for when your laptop battery begins to fade.
docs.lead_paragraph: Q. If I archive a Gmail message in my browser, what does that do and where does the message go?

docs.abstract: How to use two-step verification to guard against unauthorized access to your email.
docs.snippet: How to use two-step verification to guard against unauthorized access to your email.

docs.abstract: Tips on how to transfer photographs into iPhoto on your Mac, and advice for connecting to a virtual private network from a mobile device.
docs.snippet: Tips on how to transfer photographs into iPhoto on your Mac, and advice for connecting to a virtual private network from a mobile device.

docs.abstract: The company plans to invest $2 billion in creating a data center in Mesa, Ariz., after it dropped plans to produce sapphire, a hardened and light material, at the facility.
docs.snippet: The company plans to invest $2 billion in creating a data center in Mesa, Ariz., after it dropped plans to produce sapphire, a hardened and light material, at the facility.
docs.lead_paragraph: When you’re as rich as Apple and life gives you lemons, you make data centers.

headline.main: Apple to Open Giant Data Center in Arizona

docs.abstract: The computer giant was ordered to pay $532.9 million to Smartflash, which is based in a building down the street from where the trial was held. Apple plans to appeal.
docs.snippet: The computer giant was ordered to pay $532.9 million to Smartflash, which is based in a building down the street from where the trial was held. Apple plans to appeal.
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal jury decided this week that Apple should pay $532.9 million in damages for violating patents held by Smartflash, a business based in Texas.

headline.main: Apple Loses Patent Case to Small Texas Company
